data.text: Using Solar Panels to Top Up Battery Packs on a Bicycle Tour

Anyone using solar panels to top up battery packs while cycling? Totally appreciate that decent/direct sunlight in the UK can be hit and miss but was just wondering on the viability of this and if anyone had tried it. I have a few small travel solar panels (ranging from single 5w panel , upto to a foldable 14w (2x7w panels) so was wondering about attaching say the 14w one to either the front or back of my bike while out and about and connecting it to my battery pack, which I will be simultaneously(the battery pack i have is one of the few to allow charging while discharging at the same time) charging my phone and other small electrical gadgets.
I use a SON 28 dynamo as like you say the sun in europe is a bit hit and miss.

data.author: Andrew Bucknall

data.text: Hi John,ideally you want to charge the power bank from the panel, and then the device is connected to the power bank. One point to note is that most battery packs won't allow you to discharge them(ie charge a phone from the power bank) at the same time that the power bank is charging. There are some that do though, but its worth checking.
